speaker: SCAMMER
text: Good afternoon, ma'am. This is David calling from the Security Department at First National Bank. Am I speaking with Mrs. Eleanor Davies?

speaker: VICTIM
text: Yes, this is she. What's this about?

speaker: SCAMMER
text: Mrs. Davies, we've detected some unusual activity on your debit card. There appear to be two pending transactions for a large amount originating from outside the state. Are you familiar with these?

speaker: VICTIM
text: No, I haven't made any recent purchases, especially not out of state. That sounds… concerning.

speaker: SCAMMER
text: Exactly, Mrs. Davies. That's why I'm calling. To prevent any further unauthorized charges, we need to verify your identity and secure your account immediately. Could you please confirm the last four digits of your social security number?

speaker: VICTIM
text: Uh… I’m a little hesitant to give that out over the phone.

speaker: SCAMMER
text: I understand your concern, Mrs. Davies, but this is a secure line, and it's standard procedure for identity verification. I can assure you, this is necessary to protect your funds. We also need to cancel these fraudulent transactions and issue you a new card.

speaker: VICTIM
text: Okay… the last four digits are 47… wait a minute. What kind of transactions are these? Can you tell me what the amount is?

speaker: SCAMMER
text: One is for $789 to… let me see… Best Buy online, and the other is for $1250 to… uh… a travel agency in Florida.

speaker: VICTIM
text: I haven't ordered anything from Best Buy and definitely haven’t booked any travel. This is definitely not me.

speaker: SCAMMER
text: Right, Mrs. Davies. So, to proceed, I need you to confirm your one-time password that has just been sent to your registered mobile number. This will allow me to freeze the transactions.

speaker: VICTIM
text: Wait a minute… I haven’t received any text messages. This sounds… fishy. I think I’m going to call the bank directly to confirm this.

speaker: SCAMMER
text: Mrs. Davies, with all due respect, every second counts. While you're on hold, those transactions could go through! This is a time-sensitive matter. Please, just read me the OTP.
